subject: Baseball
lead_paragraph: Soon after the Yankees signed Carl Pavano for $40 million in December of 2004, the Red Sox found their own mediocre pitcher in the free-agent pool. Boston signed Matt Clement for $25 million.
snippet: Soon after the Yankees signed Carl Pavano for $40 million in December of 2004, the Red Sox found their own mediocre pitcher in the free-agent pool. Boston signed Matt Clement for $25 million.
